image.altText: Mourners attend a vigil at a memorial in Bondi Beach

props.synopsis: Crowds gathered at Bondi to lay floral tributes as Sydney Opera House was illuminated by a Hanukkah menorah, 24 hours after 15 people were killed in a "vile", anti-Semitic terror attack.

title.children: Australia mourns Bondi victims

image.altText: Kendrick holds hit hat and microphone, looking down standing on stage.

props.synopsis: American rap superstar Kendrick Lamar brought the house down at Spilt Milk in Canberra, but it was his interaction with a nine-year-old superfan that stole the show.

title.children: 'We were just crying': Kendrick Lamar serenades 9yo at Spilt Milk

image.altText: A man stares down the barrel of a camera while sitting in a room, wearing all black.

props.synopsis: One of two women stabbed in an attack at the Australian National University two years ago tells the ACT Supreme Court she will never feel safe again.

title.children: Man accused of trying to kill two women at the ANU faces court

image.altText: A woman wearing a black jacket and green top.

props.synopsis: After 24 years of Labor government, First Nations people in Australia's capital are frustrated and exhausted by a lack of meaningful progress to close the gap.

title.children: 'We are born into that fear': Canberra's failure to fix systemic racism

image.altText: An aerial view of a suburb with standalone houses.

props.synopsis: It's called the 'bush capital', but three quarters of Canberra's suburbs have recorded a decline in tree coverage.

title.children: Three quarters of the 'bush capital' sees decline in tree coverage

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe is sentenced to 30 years' jail for stabbing his Canberra zoo colleague Tshewang Choden to death in the storeroom of the kitchen area where they both worked.

title.children: Man jailed for murdering co-worker 'because he couldn't have her'

image.altText: A watch, ring, bracelet, police tape.

props.synopsis: Police allege the men travelled to Australia to rob a Canberra home, stealing distinctive, luxury items.

title.children: Four French men came to Canberra for a $10m heist, police say

image.altText: Costumes worn in Netflix's Squid Game on display in a museum.

props.synopsis: Whether it's KPop Demon Hunters, Squid Game, or Gangnam Style, Korean pop culture has made its mark in Australia — and the National Museum of Australia's new exhibition explores just that.

title.children: Exhibit explores Korean culture from Gangnam Style to KPop Demon Hunters

image.altText: All Blacks' Silver Fern Flag and the New Zealand flag

props.synopsis: The RBA's interest rate cutting cycle is at an end and now a hardcore handful of critics say they shouldn't have cut rates in the first place. Conveniently, you only need to look across the ditch to see what could've happened if we'd followed that path.

title.children: Multiple rate hikes next year? First look across the Tasman

image.altText: A snowman made of sand is seen on Christmas Day at Bondi Beach in Sydney

props.synopsis: With only nine more sleeps until Christmas, we have now entered the meteorological window of predictability — in other words, forecasts are more accurate than just guessing the weather.

title.children: Christmas Day to deliver heatwave, tropical storms and festive sunshine

image.altText: Donald Trump welcomes Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy

props.synopsis: Marathon talks between the US and Ukraine could see NATO-like security guarantees extended to Kyiv under a peace deal.

title.children: Ukraine says 'real progress' made in marathon peace talks

image.altText: A man with a white beard and balding head smiles next to a woman with shoulder-length brown hair who is also smiling

props.synopsis: Nick Reiner is being held in custody in the US according to the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department.

title.children: Son arrested on suspicion of murder after Rob Reiner and wife found dead

image.altText: The LA skyline is seen in front of mountains.

props.synopsis: US authorities say a New Year's Eve terror plot to bomb five sites in California and attack immigration agents has been thwarted.

title.children: Terrorists were planning New Year's Eve bombings in LA, US authorities say

image.altText: Rachael Carpani, a young woman with blonde hair walking down a street.

props.synopsis: The actress had recently appeared on long-running Australian soap Home and Away and frequently spoke out on a range of issues, including on the need to address domestic violence.

title.children: McLeod's Daughters star Rachael Carpani dies aged 45

image.altText: A close up of a Hong Kong man wearing a green face mask being escorted by police.

props.synopsis: Jimmy Lai, a former Hong Kong media mogul and one of the city's most outspoken critics of China, has been found guilty of sedition and collusion in a landmark national security case that has drawn international scrutiny.

title.children: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai found guilty of sedition and collusion

image.altText: An image of a bushfire at nighttime burning amongst tall trees. A firetruck is off to the side.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's emergency warning system fails as multiple bushfires threaten lives and homes in the state's south, but emergency warnings for the blazes are downgraded.

title.children: Multiple emergency bushfires downgraded across WA after website crashes

image.altText: Woman in hospital bed wearing neck brace.

props.synopsis: Melbourne woman Samantha Hind was sunbaking on her lawn when her husband ran over her. After recovering from the brink of death, she is reunited with the paramedics who saved her life.

title.children: Woman run over by car while sunbaking reunites with paramedics who saved her

image.altText: Four golden mushrooms growing in the grass of a cattle paddock.

props.synopsis: A farmer is concerned for the safety of people foraging for magic mushrooms, which he has sprayed with herbicide, as a toxicologist warns about the dangers of fungi.

title.children: Nimbin farmer warns magic mushrooms sprayed with poison

image.altText: A man and three women, all smiling.

props.synopsis: New laws to protect people from targeted violence have sailed through Tasmania's parliament, with experts celebrating their "innovative" approach. But some say the job is not done yet, with work still needed to implement them successfully.

title.children: 'Everyone is protected': Tasmania's new hate crime laws praised as nation-leading

image.altText: A pencil drawing of a woman in a bonnet with curls framing her face.

props.synopsis: Her books like Pride and Prejudice and Emma were written hundreds of years ago, but have themes that still resonate in today's society.

title.children: Jane Austen was born 250 years ago today. Here's why she is still relevant

image.altText: an aerial photo of road trains lined up next to a set of cattle yards, with yellow grasslands behind.

props.synopsis: Consolidated Pastoral Company spends more than $300 million to buy the Beetaloo aggregation of stations in the NT.

title.children: Beetaloo Station sold in historic $300m deal to CPC

image.altText: Headshot selfie of a woung woman wearing glasses

props.synopsis: A 44-year-old man admits killing Perth lawyer Alice McShera, whose body was found in a hotel room in the upmarket Crown Towers complex in 2023.

title.children: Courtroom packed as man admits murdering Perth lawyer at upmarket hotel

image.altText: Image of an incinerated bedroom, including a bed, in Guildford.

props.synopsis: A NSW inquest has been told exploding lithium-ion batteries caused volatile fires killing three people in separate blazes within minutes.

title.children: NSW inquest told how exploding lithium-ion batteries turned deadly

image.altText: A mobile phone is held in a person's hand at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: ASX bosses say they are committed to reform after the corporate regulator lashes the operator's failings in a report, saying it underestimates long-term problems, is insular and defensive with deficiencies in culture and leadership.

title.children: Shares in stock exchange operator ASX fall after damning inquiry

image.altText: luger1

props.synopsis: Australian luger Alex Ferlazzo pulls off a miracle recovery after falling off his sled halfway through a run.

title.children: Australian luger makes stunning recovery mid-run after falling off sled

image.altText: police

props.synopsis: Police say they are responding to a crash that has claimed the lives of four people near Cobram in Victoria's north.

title.children: Four dead, five hospitalised after minivan crash in Victoria's north

image.altText: A woman pushes Natasha Fyles with one hand and pushes a paper plate into her face with the other hand

props.synopsis: A former Darwin real estate agent charged with assaulting the Northern Territory's then-chief minister with a plate of crepes has tried to justify her actions as a "protest" against COVID-19 rules.

title.children: Alleged crepe assault on ex-NT leader left her 'visibly distressed', court hears

image.altText: Nathan Lyon looks to his left while wearing cap

props.synopsis: For the first time in an age Nathan Lyon is not an automatic selection in the Test side but the returning off spinner insists he has nothing to prove ahead of the upcoming clash with England in Adelaide.

title.children: Why Nathan Lyon believes he has nothing to prove on Test return

image.altText: A bald man with a neck tattoo exits a prison van on his way to the Supreme Court

props.synopsis: A judge says the offending of a man found guilty of kidnapping a Victorian 19-year-old, who was later murdered, was "spontaneous" and "born of panic".

title.children: Man convicted of kidnapping 19yo Charlie Gander now eligible for parole

image.altText: A person donates blood, squeezing a pink sponge in a medical setting. Medical equipment visible, a calm, focused atmosphere.

props.synopsis:
Lifeblood Australia has issued an urgent call out for blood donations, especially type O negative.
 
Since the call-out, over 20,000 blood donation appointments have been made, making it the largest community response since the 2009 Black Saturday fires.

title.children: Australians rally to donate blood as shortages hit following mass shooting

image.altText: A water truck pumping water at Quinninup townsite.

props.synopsis: Quinninup and Northcliffe in Western Australia's south-west receive an average of 1 metre of rain every year, so why has the state government spent millions of dollars trucking in drinking water?

title.children: The state government has trucked water to WA's wettest towns for 15 years

image.altText: Dolphin Sands bushfire emergency,

props.synopsis: A bushfire in Tasmania that destroyed 19 homes was caused by a registered burn conducted about a week earlier, which was not extinguished by a landowner, authorities have confirmed.

title.children: Bushfire caused by burn-off not extinguished properly

image.altText: A group of formally dressed people smile and hold trophies in celebration in a group portrait on the edge of a stage.

props.synopsis: ABC journalist Adele Ferguson is among three directors who have resigned from the board of Australia's most prestigious journalism awards over governance issues.

title.children: Three independent directors of the Walkley Foundation resign over reform stoush

image.altText: A baby lays on the edge of a bed.

props.synopsis: A man charged over a crash that killed a one-month-old baby on the Gold Coast has been granted bail following an 11-week police investigation.

title.children: Man charged over newborn's death in Gold Coast M1 crash granted bail

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis plantations

props.synopsis: There doesn't seem to be much political mileage for the government to do anything at all — whether that is cracking down and forcing cannabis users back onto the black market or fully legalising the substance.

title.children: Australia's medicinal cannabis situation is unattractive for politicians
